Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Sakhmet
Description: This amulet in blue faience represents the goddess Sakhmet standing, with the body of a woman and the head of a lioness. She is wearing a tripartite wig on which the mane rests. On the head is a dressed uraeus accompanied by the solar disk. The goddess, who wears a long robe just to the ankles, is leaning against a pillar of which the uper part is slightly rounded. The piece, which is in a good state of preservation, dates from the Late Period or from the Ptolemaic Period.
